medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric pain described as burning, sharp, and constant for 5 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until 5 days ago when she developed epigastric pain. She delayed seeking medical attention due to family obligations and ultimately sought care today after the pain persisted. The pain was self-limited and resolved within a day about 2 weeks ago. She denies nausea, experienced one episode of non-bilious vomiting several days ago, and has had limited oral intake but was able to drink water. Urination is adequate with no concentration issues. No fever or chills present.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, migraines. Past surgical history includes laser surgery for cervical dysplasia.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of gallstones (mother and father), coronary artery disease (father), osteoporosis (mother).
